alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:35AM EST until January 29 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Iroquois and Newton Counties. For the Iroquois River...including Iroquois, Foresman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near I-65 east of Foresman downstream to near US-41 north of Kentland, including the Foresman gauge. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, 1000 South Road threatened north of the river near Brook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CST Sunday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.3 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight CST.
